intro: Dasymaschalon cleistogamum, commonly known as the cleistogamous dasymaschalon, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its unique reproductive strategy, producing closed, self-pollinating flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub with woody stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small, greenish-yellow, and lack showy petals, which is typical of cleistogamous species. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
